Hi all,

I've just finished part 3 of the tutorial on using SharpNEAT 2:

http://www.nashcoding.com/2010/10/29/tutorial-%E2%80%93-evolving-neural-networks-with-sharpneat-2-part-3/

The running example throughout this series is building a Tic-Tac-Toe AI. 
This part covers how to use HyperNEAT in the experiment.

I'd appreciate any feedback, as always. I'm particularly interested if 
Colin (or anyone else familiar with SN2 and HyperNEAT) finds anything 
wrong with my experiment setup/code. Also, I've made some 
simplifications to terminology. If I made any erroneous simplifications, 
please let me know and I'll correct them.

Note that there was some discussion about using a non-coevolution setup. 
I still plan on doing that, but this part doesn't have that piece. I 
figured it's better to release the part I have done, since I've had a 
few people ask for the HyperNEAT component.

Wesley
